Detailed Description

template<class TBase>
class WTL::CAnimateCtrlT< TBase >

The animation control.

The CAnimateCtrlT class provides the functionality of the Windows common animation control.

An animation control is a rectangular window that displays a clip in AVI (Audio Video Interleaved) format the standard Windows video/audio format. An AVI clip is a series of bitmap frames, like a movie.

Definition at line 5657 of file atlctrls.h.

Member Function Documentation

template<class TBase>
BOOL WTL::CAnimateCtrlT< TBase >::Close (    )  [inline]
 

Closes the movie clip.

Use the Close member function to close the AVI clip that was previously opened in the animation control (if any) and remove it from memory.

Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<class TBase>
HWND WTL::CAnimateCtrlT< TBase >::Create (  HWND    hWndParent,
_U_RECT    rect = NULL,
LPCTSTR    szWindowName = NULL,
DWORD    dwStyle = 0,
DWORD    dwExStyle = 0,
_U_MENUorID    MenuOrID = 0U,
LPVOID    lpCreateParam = NULL
)  [inline]
 

Creates an animation control.

Creates a new animation control

Parameters:
hWndParent  A Window handle to the parent/owner.
rect  Specifies the animation control’s position and size. It can be either a CRect object or a RECT structure.
szWindowName  Should be NULL.
dwStyle  Specifies the animation control’s style. Apply any combination of the window and animation control styles described under Remarks to the control.
dwExStyle  Extended Window style.
MenuOrID  Specifies the animation control’s ID.
lpCreateParam  Optional creation parameters
Returns:
The handle of the new control. NULL if it fails.

template<class TBase>
BOOL WTL::CAnimateCtrlT< TBase >::Open (  _U_STRINGorID    FileName )  [inline]
 

Opens a movie.

Opens an AVI clip and display its first frame.

Parameters:
FileName  A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains either the name of the AVI file or the name of an AVI resource. If this parameter is NULL, the system closes the AVI clip that was previously opened for the animation control, if any.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 5663 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
BOOL WTL::CAnimateCtrlT< TBase >::Play (  UINT    nFrom,
UINT    nTo,
UINT    nRep
)  [inline]
 

Plays a movie.

Plays an AVI clip in an animation control. The animation control will play the clip in the background while your thread continues executing.

Parameters:
nFrom  Zero-based index of the frame where playing begins. Value must be less than 65,536. A value of 0 means begin with the first frame in the AVI clip.
nTo  Zero-based index of the frame where playing ends. Value must be less than 65,536. A value of –1 means end with the last frame in the AVI clip.
nRep  Number of times to replay the AVI clip. A value of 1 means replay the file indefinitely.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Definition at line 5688 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
BOOL WTL::CAnimateCtrlT< TBase >::Seek (  UINT    nTo )  [inline]
 

Displays a movie frame.

Statically display a single frame of your AVI clip.

Parameters:
nTo  Zero-based index of the frame to display. Value must be less than 65,536. A value of 0 means display the first frame in the AVI clip. A value of 1 means display the last frame in the AVI clip.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.
